name: Djayantie, Ayam Goreng & Iga Bakar
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat No.19F, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: A pretty humble place in teuku umar. Good option for affordable halal food in bali. Ayam penyet is 10/10 and the kangkung goreng blews my mind. The food is bussin but will be ecen better if the place can be cleaner, not to mention the toilet
review 2:
Such a tasty local food to try!
The best menu is bebek I think. Last visit, I ate bebek penyet, including kangkung goreng. That's the best! You must try it. They give you 2 choices of sambal, the red and green one. The red one is spicier.
The place is clean and big enough. But, never come around 8 to 10 at night, it's too crowded.
The service is so so. The price is affordable enough. My last order was 50k rupiah.
.
.
Update: my second visit, the place was a bit dirty.
review 3:
They serve fried duck and beef also fried vegetables (water spinach)

Fried duck so huge, so juicy, but so much fried oil, chili sauce is so freaking delicious, fried water spinach is so good but also so oily

Spacious table available for dine in, available grab and gojek online order

Affordable price
Should try
review 4:
Extremely overpriced the iga.
i ordered some iga bakar jumbo for each 70k. what i got was some oily full of fat cheapest local meat chunks. no seasoning. the vegis were extremely salty. i can‚Äôt recommend that warung because after eating all this oily food, i felt not well‚Ä¶.
review 5: The food was soooo good, especially iga bakar. But the plastic glass isn‚Äôt a good idea ü•≤

name: Ayam Kari & Rempah Mang Jaja
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1: The best Ayam Kari I ever had! Cannot believe I missed this super delicious place for a long time lol PLEASE KEEP THE TASTE!!! I'll be a regular customer from now on.
review 2: Tried their Ayam Kari for 23k yesterday and it turned out quite delicious, and the price quite worth it. They are generous with the portion of rice but my friend said the Sambal was a little bit salty. Overall, this place can be your recommendation for Ayam Kari and Ayam Rempah.
review 3:
Food was amazing! tastes super rich, a bit spicy..portion size is spot on

best finding in 2024 IMHO
review 4:
The curry has strong herbs. Even the aftertaste I can still taste the herbs a lot. It tastes okay, but not for frequent visits. The price is also a bit high, but still okay for me.
They open 24 hours!
review 5: The best indonesian curry we have ever tried in Bali and ayam goreng  is delicious. A lot of herbs, yummy. mak nyus...Recommended

name: Bakso Gepeng AA
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat No.18, Pemecutan Klod, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1:
Very long queue, we waited for more than 1 hour to finally the Meatballs is being served. For me personally "Bakso Gepeng with Bihun" was tasty even though only got 5pcs Bakso while the noodles dominance in the bowl.

Service was fine, just need an extra seating tables cause what they have now did not cover all the customers. Some people have to standing to wait for table turn over. Price is fair enough for the portion we got, my friends said the "Bakso Urat" is much better and more meatty.

For you guys who really curious about how it taste like, I would be suggest you to order via online instead.
review 2:
Tempted by massive TikTok food ‚Äúreviews‚Äù, I decided to try this most recent viral Bakso in Denpasar.
Long queues for 1 hour but the food is so good, defo I‚Äôll do repeat order after 6 months ofc.
Somehow I feel like the taste of bakso urat kinda like famous bakso Soni one. But not really taste the same. The bakso soup is really thick and rich (I prefer adding more garlic oil on it).
And I got free Iga also, so yeah totally worth it.
Big portion for me.
review 3:
I was thrilled to find a meatball stand in Bali reminiscent of my Jakarta days. While the prices were considered cheap compared to Jakarta, the overall experience left me with mixed feelings. Perhaps my expectations were too high, as the food turned out to be just average. I believe an upgrade in ingredient quality could transform these meatballs into something truly delicious.

The long queues were a drawback, making the wait feel less worthwhile. Despite these aspects, there's a lot of potentials for improvement, and I hope they consider enhancing the culinary experience.
review 4: Taste good enough but not so special,bakso urat way better than bakso gepeng.
review 5:
Above average in Bali standard. Not cheap, paying a bit more you can get Baso Afung.
Not worth the queue.

name: Alkyfa Hotel Bali
address: Jl. Pura Demak No.8, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: Quite cozy for three star hotel, close to many kinds of food places you like. Also near gas station that will make you enjoy your staying. The balcony in the 5th floor is wonderfull with the greenies and also there is toilet to use for. Happy staying
review 2: No shampoo, no soap, no table, no wifi, but hotel place quite strategist
review 3: Room hotel was very clean, ac working so good, and the bed very comfortable and smell so goo. Friendly and helpful staff.
review 4: Near with mosque, and have good food, also surrounded by so many food stals, whether it's traditional or modern food.
review 5: Gud sangat this hotel bekaus have e naes rum

name: bakso Bomok
address: Jl. Kerta Pura No.3, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: This is the local bakso that is most well-known in the Teuku Umar area. The location is quite basic and a bit dirty, and it‚Äôs often too crowded. They don‚Äôt have enough space, making it a bit challenging to eat there. They offer both small bakso, but the most well-known option is the big bakso. The prices are average, and the taste can vary from day to day. In fact, it might be better if they relocated somewhere else, given the high number of repeat customers, to ensure that everyone can enjoy their meal more comfortably. üôÅüëçüèª
review 2: Absolutely overrated and overpriced place to dine. Theres no place to sit because of too crowd, the table is also too narrow for even put your own bowls. Theres not enough ketchup, sauce, chilis for each table.. so they're keep bothering you by asking for whats on yours. But when I asked for tissue, they looks confuse like they didnt even know if the tissue is already done for. The taste is soso and its 36K for each bowl!
review 3: Have been twice visit here and still not opened yet. They said 7.00pm but once we waited till 8.30 still not opened yet...Don't wanna come again or recomended..deleted from my list. Sorry for that
review 4: Place is packed, food is good. Just a hard time getting a seat

name: Ayam Bakar Wo Ai Ni 2
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat No.123, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1:
One of the best grilled chicken in town!
Located on Teuku Umar Barat street, this restaurant is really easy to find. They have enough parking area for motorbikes and also cars. This restaurant is quite spacious with many seats. The grilled chicken is the most recommended menu you should try because it's reallyyyyy tastyü§§
Every meats are well-seasoned and paired with spicy sambal. Don't worry about the price because it's totally affordableü§ü
review 2: My go-to food, the grilled chicken are flavourful, since i can't eat sambal, i didn't tried it, but most of my friend said that it was really great!! Please do try it yourself
review 3:
Delicious food, very very fast service, many seating capacity, affordable prices. It's on the street side,  very spot on if passing west teuku umar road in Denpasar.  Very recommend place for eating grilled chicken. Chilli was spicy enough.
So don't missed it if you're passing by and stop for delicious food.
review 4:
So, yeah, wow! Went to this place for the first time, back in 2010, and they were located behind, in the alley.

It's been 8 years, and look at them now, place so large! Great success!!!

The best and amazing thing is, their taste didn't change at all!!! Or at least as I recalled after 8 years!

The sambal, chilli, was always the best. Ate 2 porsion of Ayam Bakar, and loads of tofu and the list went on! LOL.

Definitely recommended! And will return any time soon!
review 5: Feel the traditional grill chicken indonesian style with spicy sambal...prepare alot of drinks if u can't handle the spicy...the taste of the grill chicken was so good...u also can taste the fried chicken and some fried tempe or tofu...

name: OYO 1949 Vrindavan Residence
address: Jl. Pulau Indah No.05, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80237, Indonesia
review 1: Really bad services, the staff was rude. So uncomfortavle
review 2:
On 7 May I booked a room via one of the apps. The man in the reception refused to give us the room and wanted to charge us 250000 IDR instead of 178544IDR. Because he doesn't like the price on the App.
After we lift they charged us the cancellation fee from my Visa. 178544 IDR. I sent them email and trying to call them on the phone but no reply.
review 3:
Worst experience ever,  dirty room and the receptionist can't speak English.
Never again
review 4: Very nice hotel,just need to add a few things in the room
review 5: not bad for daily or weekly stay

name: Kost Nyaman
address: Jl. Pulau Pinang No.4, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: visited a friend who loves here. parking is more than sufficient. Reasonable monthly price for those who earn IDR 10 mill a month (USD 850 ) or more and still single.
review 2: The place is good and the facilities is well-enough for single or family. But, needs more speed on its WiFi internet. I suggest to leave Biznet as ISP and find another good provider that offer dedicated lines.

name: Ten%
address: Jalan P.Batanta IV No.37, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: another hidden GEM in city of Denpasar, place for coffee, snack and chill under the tree with the amazing river view. You can relax have a drinks while enjoying the breeze. Croissants and drinks were delicious ü§§. will be back ‚òïÔ∏è‚òïÔ∏è
review 2: The view overlooking the river with the sounds of nature and water is delightful. The friendly service and unique tent concept for enjoying coffee add to the experience.
review 3: Really enjoy spending an afternoon here, watching the sunset and river. Their staffs are very friendly and welcome. Will come back for sure. Very nice spot for hangout.
review 4:
Nice Ice Latte .
Quaint little coffee stall and friendly faces !
Definitely worth to drop by
review 5: A cute unassuming coffee tent by the riverbank. Breezy and shady, perfect for a post lunch coffee fix.

name: Brandes coffee & eatery
address: Jl. Pulau Batanta Gg. IVB, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: The place was good next to the river plus the have table and chairs below the river also restroom. Food and beverage were great, staff were nice.

name: Baljam - Baliku Jamur
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat No.19b, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: If you crave for something fried, then this is the place. This place is all about deep fried street food, they have many option for the menu and have spaghetti too. Although their speciality is deep fried mushroom, I can say their chicken is so good that they coated it with sweet and spicy sauce! They also have playground for kids too. Overall it was a nice place to have a quick bite.
review 2: Been here once, my expectations was the jamur crispy is freshly fried but I got the cold one. It wasn‚Äôt good at all but we have no choice and finish the dish anyway. but the other food cooked properly and served hot. i just dont get why is the jamur crispy served cold.
review 3:
Coming here because of instagram ads... not a cheap dish,,, but not expensive also, love the ambience at nigth here,,, food is 4,5 / 5,but the beverages is 5/5,
good,,,
review 4:
Used to order it using online application.
Once i try to dine in, and the foods taste so much better when dining in, especially if ordering mozzarella as the topping
review 5: They have small playground for kids. The mushroom as always, very good

name: Warung Babi Guling Nyoman Samprig
address: 857V+86H, Jl. Imam Bonjol, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: The cheapest Babi Guling I've ever triedüëçüèªüëçüèª the condiment are complete and the taste was very goodüòãüòã
review 2: Generous portion and delicious. I love their soup, the flavor was so rich. One portion will only cost you IDR 17,000. A very cheap meal.
review 3: Highly recommended, Nasi Campur Special only 25K, and the portion is big. The biggest among other that i already try. The owner also very nice and friendly.
review 4: The taste here never change, still attract crowd. And be prepare if you come here at lunch time, there's many people that came by to have lunch. So don't complain if they serve you too long. The price is cheap but the taste is good
review 5: affordable and tasty but the place is a bit small

name: Mandalawangi
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat No.15, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: Really great and authentic Indonesian food with a lot of sambal (spices). But the portions are very small so keep that in mind
review 2: Stopped by because look alike my mom‚Äôs kitchen. Well spent cheating day! My first time tried their Oseng Daging and crispy tofu. Taste like home cooking actually. The level of spicy are mid and their Kuah Kuning is so good. I can‚Äôt wait until my next cheating day to eat their Bebek Goreng !
review 3:
good place for quick bite, they have indoor and outdoor place. this restaurant have a quite wide parking lot for 2 cars and some motorcycle.
for the price is so so, I love the 'mie goreng bebek' a duck fried noodles with a lot of duck meat.
and I tried the 'es cincau' and mocha coffee but not too sweet.
they have a clean wastafel but hot hand dryer
review 4:
Have to pay attention with the name, it's Binjay instead of Sinjay, the most popular duck dish from Madura Island.

Anyway, regardless the name, I still wouldn't recommend the duck dish here. The meat is a bit chewy although it's not too greasy. The skin isn't crispy at all, although it's also not chewy. The ati and ampela satay isn't eatable at all. The rice is a small portion for the price and although we have to order it separately from the duck dish, they serve them on one plate.

The ambience is nice, but the service is terrible. The waitress just literally throw the menu on the table so I raised my eyebrows and told her to be polite. She went red then walked away, another one came to take my order. My friend arrived a few minutes late and we have to call the waitress to bring another menu. We were sitting at the furthest point, so we have to walk to the bar to ask for the bill and we have to pay inside as nobody were around. We might be able to walk out without paying if we want to. When I asked to have a doggy bag they just give me a plastic bag instead of bringing the left over inside then wrap them up for me. So I just left everything and walked out. The worst service I've ever experienced.
review 5:
Good food.
If you order coffee and you don't drink coffee with sugar, you should tell the staff. I got ice cappuccino that is very sweet and the coffee beans itself was the sour kind not the bitter one, so it tastes a bit weird for me. P.s: no alcohol is available.

name: Matahari Guest House Denpasar
address: 858W+8HX, Pemecutan Klod, Denpasar Barat, Denpasar City, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: This has to be the worst place I have ever stayed in Bali. No one could speak a word of English, room was not cleaned, ants all through the room, had to sit sideways on the loo cause the bathroom was to skinny. No loo paper, no water in room. Window to a wall didn't open.
review 2:
Price : 9/10
Ambiance : Quite
Service : 8/10
So far good place, homey like kos2an. Recommended bcs airy guarantee your clean bed, hot water etc. There is just one probs, until day 2 i stay there, the hot water in my room is not working, but then i tell the receptionist then they fix it immediately. The receptionists are good, however you need to add more people in reception since there is only one people in charge every day i think. And also i think it would be better if they add a freezer for all the guests to use, cause it might very useful
review 3: Nice place, clean bed, floor a bit dusty, no hot shower
review 4: Nice clean place and quite in the middle of busy denpasar city

name: Ibukota Coffee & Eatery 2
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat No.15, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: Ordered matcha latte hot and an almond croissant. The matcha is a little too sweet and it's more like warm rather than hot. The pastry was alright. The atmosphere is good. There is an indoor seating area and outdoor seating area.
review 2: Served completley raw meat, tasted off.  Payed for our meals as to not be difficult but the food was so bad that we did not eat and left. Definitely not worth the price considering the warungs around it serve better food for cheaper.

name: Mie Bandung
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: One of the best place to have noodles in Bali. Their noodles somehow are different than your usual noodles, which are more firm and not overly chewy. When paired with some soup, it will taste so good! Totally recommended for those who wants something different.
review 2: Not a big place to eat, the menu here is noodles, kwetiawand fried rice, this place is popular for noodle lovers, especially Bandung noodles because it tastes right on the tongue, the price is what we get.  My favorite here is the free pickled cucumber.  Parking space for motorbikes is not a problem but it's a bit difficult if you have a car. ''
review 3: Love their Yamien Manis Ayam Jamur Pangsit...also good price. Place little bit small, but still ok for a simple noodle shop in Bali.
review 4: As a noodle lover, I like their green noodle! They taste good, and seem like a healthier option! We also ordered their pangsit goreng, which had a pretty generous portion.
review 5:
Recommended by a coffee shop barista, which turned out to be good! Even better than other ‚Äòfamous‚Äô noodle shop stall. The broth is balance (not too MSG salty like most other places).

Green noodle was chewy and portion was okay (considering the affordable price).

Kwetiauw was good too!

Located in a busy street so expect a loud noise and dust, just eat quickly. Friendly staff too.

name: Cove Matahari Senja
address: Jl, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1:
Was looking for a room where i can work alone, and i got the right place at the right time!

On the bright side, The room was spacious. The cleanliness is so-so and okay. The furniture was nicely polished. The desk was good for working. Staffs were very friendly. Lots of culinary spot nearby. No illegal couple allowed to lurk around, which made it safe for me who wanted serenity.

But on the flipside, The street noise was crippling in as many vehicles passed by. The amenities wasn‚Äôt all in. But I‚Äôm okay with all that

For the price range, i lowkey think this is the best place for backpackers who want to stay at a nice, strategic spot while saving money. Great value for money.

One caveat though. Seems that the booking system in traveloka stays open although the receptionist has updated the room capacity. Worst case is that you can arrive and be told there‚Äôs no room left while the system said the opposite when you book it. Have talked to the receptionist, seen the issue my self, and convinced that this is the system issue.

To avoid this, best to call the receptionist first off to confirm the capacity, before booking a room. Hope cove resolve this issue.
review 2: Based on my experience, the place is nice, its affordable and with that price its already pretty good

name: Nasi Gandul Super Warung Hero
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat No.19 E, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: Great food, great menu. The nasi gandul was great and the jahe hit the spot. Owner was welcoming and wholesome.
review 2:
This is a major hug on a plate. The flavourful broth mixed with the superb chilli sauce is a godsent for late night suppers.

Would come back for more (and I mean a few plates of this goodness).

My only advice is don't share a portion, go on and be selfish. You will thank me for it.
review 3: Warung Hero has Nasi Gandul as it‚Äôs main dish, but also offers any kind of Indomie. Nasi Gandul tasted just okay, with decent amount of meat, the soup tasted like regular Gandul with less spices. Had STMJ too and it was warm and soothing, the ginger water tasted good‚Äînot spicy. They have various snacks like toast, tahu bacem, and else. This place has it‚Äôs busy hours at late night, after 10pm. Price is affordable, IDR 20k/pax. Parking area is spacious.
review 4:
Food is good - nasi gandul is indonesian dish, they also sell indomie and pisang goreng.
Service - is okay, you have to initiate the order, and if you ask for anything else. They super busy, sometimes forget, but theyre good.
Atmosphere - casual dine or late night supper, streetfood style, plenty of seat, outdoor setting.
Price - is relatively cheap.
review 5: (Almost) authenthic taste of Nasi Gandul in Bali's capital city. Beef was really tender, soup was really rich with just the right amount of sweetness. Quail eggs also tasted great. It'll be great if there were more options for toppings.

name: Anugerah GuestHouse
address: Gg. Marlboro VII No.6, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: Easy access, full furniture

name: Sate Padang SYUKUR
address: Jl. Teuku Umar Barat No.19A, Pemecutan Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80119, Indonesia
review 1: Used the delivery app to order this, taste good, the sate lidah (ox tongue skewers) for me is a musy.
review 2:
New place for me and my fam when we want to eat Satay Padang
Found this place when my son want to try Satay Padang,so i used Gr*b food apps to search and decided to order from this stall
And it‚Äôs a success we all love the sauce and the satay was really tender
Decided to visit the stall last week,not too big but it‚Äôa clean
Ordered more dishes compared to the first time i ordered through apps,it‚Äôs all good except the beef satay
This time the beef satay is too dry and tough,my wife didn‚Äôt like it so she order chicken satay
And the beef satay is one of the most expensive menu here,so it‚Äôs should be the main star
Hopefully they can improve it,since the other menu is really good
review 3: Every bite i take remind me of my hometown satay. This is the one place that you looking if you wanted to eat sate/satay from west sumatera. With the yellow/green secret spicy sauce pair with the thick juicy ketupat. Taste like heaven. Kinda pricey for indonesian food but worth every penny
review 4:
Came here cause I wanted to eat Sate Padang but surprised to see that also serve Soto Padang and also Lontong Sayur Padang.

Me and my friend eventually tried the Soto and Lontong. The taste was okay but not something  "memorable" for me. Want I love is that they do offer various Padangnese dishes, drinks and also thw  ussual condiments like kerupuk "Jangek"

I will surely come back to this restaurant if I have a longing for Padang dishes

The place is not big so I think the appropriate word to call this place is a "warung" it does have some quirky and unique decoration though
review 5: The best sate padang in Bali (so far).. This is what happens when a real Padangnese sells sate padang... Many acclaims "sate Padang" in Bali, but none of them taste this good. The price of the food is affordable and they offered many food options. I cant say that the food is pricey but the taste is equal to its pricing. Hope you guys will survive this pandemic and keep on going and serving the best sate padang!
